revision.comment: Created page with "Possibly: The Koran, Commonly Called the Alcoran of Mohammed, Translated into English immediately from the Original Arabic; with Explanatory Notes Taken from the most Approved..."
revision.text: Possibly: The Koran, Commonly Called the Alcoran of Mohammed, Translated into English immediately from the Original Arabic; with Explanatory Notes Taken from the most Approved Commentators, to Which is Prefixed, a Preliminary Discourse. By George Sale, Gent. (London : Printed for L. Hawes W. Clarke, and R. Collins, at the Red Lion in Pater Noster Row; and T. Wilcox, at Virgil's Head, overagainst the New Church, in the Strand, MDCCLXIV [1764]). http://library.st-andrews.ac.uk/record=b2407608~S1
